Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani partially dislocated his left shoulder on a slide at second base
Tommy Edman and Teoscar Hernández hit home runs off Carlos Rodón
Giancarlo Stanton’s one-out RBI single in the ninth brought the Yankees to within 4-2
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers are heading to New York uncertain whether Shohei Ohtani can play due to his injury
Yoshinobu Yamamoto gave up three home runs in seven scoreless innings
Los Angeles took a 2-0 Series lead for the first time since 1988
Post-Match Reflections: Yamamoto improved to 2-0 in four postseason starts
Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in Series history
Alex Vesia recorded his first postseason save
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ohtani’s MRI and availability will be anxiously awaited
Los Angeles had back-to-back Series homers for just the second time
Jazz Chisholm Jr. singled and Anthony Rizzo was hit by a pitch for the second time in the game
